CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in New Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, December 16, 1967, page 1 reads: "Pettigrew Tours Homewood - Ex-Army Capt. Pettigrew, attached to the Leech Farm Armory, is shown during a recent tour of the Homewood-Brushton area to view its many window-cracked some fire-bombed and fleeing businesses. A native Pittsburgher, Pettigrew is enlisting citizens and organizations in launching a counter-attack which will curb the vandalism attributed to black extremists, deter businessmen who are contemplating leaving the area, and halt the cancellation of fire and property damage insurance in the area.  Harris Photo"
TitMainTitle: Thomas H. Pettigrew, standing at the intersection of Bennett Street and Homewood Avenue, with Belmar Theatre and Second Federal Savings and Loan Association, Homewood
